meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>refuse</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to refuse</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: What are you refusing? You are refusing a child, because children are all bad. You say "<reading>子 ba</reading>d, <reading>子 ba</reading>d" over and over again.
